title: NetApp ONTAP
description: A practical, command-heavy reference for NetApp ONTAP administration (clusters, SVMs, volumes, LIFs), NAS (NFS/SMB), SAN (iSCSI/FC/NVMe), snapshots, SnapMirror replication, networking, security/RBAC, monitoring, and automation via REST, PowerShell Toolkit, Ansible, and Python.

categories.title: Fundamentals and Architecture
categories.description: Core ONTAP concepts and how the platform is structured.

rows: A group of nodes managed as one storage system.
A physical controller or ONTAP Select instance in a cluster.
Storage Virtual Machine; logical tenant containing data interfaces, volumes, and protocol configuration.
A pool of disks/partitions providing storage to volumes.
Logical container for NAS/SAN data; thin provisioning, snapshots, efficiency.
Logical Interface (IP or FC); the data/network endpoint clients connect to.
Block device presented over iSCSI/FC/NVMe (mapped to initiator groups).
Space-efficient, point-in-time copy of a volume.
ONTAP S3 object storage service (feature dependent).

items.title: CLI modes and common help
items.description: ONTAP has privilege levels (admin/advanced). Be cautious in advanced mode.
items.example:
version
cluster identity show
set -privilege advanced

categories.title: Access, Accounts, and RBAC
categories.description: Authentication, users, roles, and SSH access.

items.title: Users and roles (cluster)
items.description: Roles and logins can be scoped to the cluster or an SVM.

rows: security login create -user-or-group-name <user> -application ssh -authentication-method password -role admin

items.example:
security login show
security login role show

items.title: SSH and session controls
items.example: security session show

categories.title: Cluster and Node Administration
categories.description: Inventory, health, HA state, and basic node operations.

items.title: Cluster status and health
items.example:
cluster show
system health status show
system health alert show

items.title: HA and takeover/giveback
items.description: Exact commands/availability can vary by ONTAP version and platform.
items.example: storage failover show

items.title: Time, DNS, NTP (cluster)
items.example:
dns show
system services ntp server show

categories.title: Networking
categories.description: Ports, VLANs, interfaces (LIFs), failover groups, and routing.

items.title: Ports, VLANs, and broadcast domains
items.description: Network object model differs by ONTAP version; these are common show commands.
items.example:
network port show
network port vlan show

items.title: LIF management
items.description: LIFs are your data endpoints. Plan home ports and failover policies carefully.
items.example: network interface show -fields vserver,lif,role,data-protocol,address,home-node,home-port,admin-status,oper-status

items.title: Routing
items.example: network route show

categories.title: Storage Aggregates and Disks
categories.description: Physical storage inventory, aggregates, and capacity management.

items.title: Disks and shelves (inventory)
items.example:
storage disk show
storage aggregate show-spare-disks

items.title: Aggregates
items.example: storage aggregate show -fields state,size,usedsize,avail,percent-used

categories.title: SVMs (Vservers)
categories.description: Tenant/namespace administration: create, list, and manage SVM settings.

items.title: SVM lifecycle and settings
items.example: vserver show -fields vserver,type,state,subtype,allowed-protocols

categories.title: Volumes (FlexVol)
categories.description: Create/manage volumes, junctions, permissions, snapshots, and efficiency.

items.title: Volume create and inventory
items.description: Prefer explicit aggregate selection and junction paths for NAS.
items.example:
volume create -vserver svm1 -volume vol1 -aggregate aggr1 -size 200G
volume mount -vserver svm1 -volume vol1 -junction-path /data/vol1

items.title: Snapshots
items.description: Snapshots are typically per-volume and space-efficient. Retention is controlled via policies.
items.example: volume snapshot create -vserver svm1 -volume vol1 -snapshot prechange

items.title: Storage efficiency
items.description: Dedupe/compression/compaction settings vary by ONTAP version and platform.
items.example: volume efficiency show -vserver svm1 -volume vol1

items.title: Quota overview
items.description: User/group/tree quotas (NAS) for controlling consumption.
items.example: volume quota report -vserver svm1 -volume vol1

categories.title: NFS (NAS)
categories.description: NFS server config, exports, and common diagnostics.

items.title: NFS service
items.example:
vserver nfs status -vserver svm1
vserver nfs show -vserver svm1

items.title: Export policies and rules
items.description: Export policies control NFS access; rules are ordered and matched by client/ro/rw/etc.

rows: vserver export-policy rule create -vserver <svm> -policyname <policy> -ruleindex 1 -protocol nfs3,nfs4 -clientmatch <cidr_or_host> -rorule sys -rwrule sys

items.example:
vserver export-policy show -vserver svm1
vserver export-policy rule show -vserver svm1 -policyname default

categories.title: SMB/CIFS (NAS)
categories.description: SMB server setup, shares, and common checks.

items.title: SMB server and shares
items.example: vserver cifs share show -vserver svm1

items.title: Sessions and open files
items.description: Useful when troubleshooting locking and access problems.
items.example:
vserver cifs session show -vserver svm1
vserver cifs open-file show -vserver svm1

categories.title: SAN (iSCSI/FC/NVMe)
categories.description: LUNs, initiator groups (igroups), mappings, and protocol status.

items.title: iSCSI
items.example:
vserver iscsi status -vserver svm1
vserver iscsi session show -vserver svm1

items.title: LUNs, igroups, and mapping
items.description: Most SAN workflows are: create volume -> create LUN -> create igroup -> map LUN -> set host multipathing.
items.example:
lun create -vserver svm1 -path /vol/vol_san/lun01 -size 100G -ostype linux
igroup create -vserver svm1 -igroup ig01 -protocol iscsi -ostype linux -initiator iqn.1993-08.org.debian:01:aaaa
lun mapping create -vserver svm1 -path /vol/vol_san/lun01 -igroup ig01

items.title: FC (overview commands)
items.description: FC configuration is environment-specific; use show commands to verify target ports and sessions.
items.example:
vserver fcp status -vserver svm1
vserver fcp show -vserver svm1

categories.title: Replication: SnapMirror
categories.description: DR and data protection via SnapMirror relationships, schedules, and monitoring.

items.title: Relationship inventory and status
items.example:
snapmirror show
snapmirror show-transfers

items.title: Initialize and update (high level)
items.description: Exact setup depends on policies, peering, and version. Use these as building blocks.
items.example:
snapmirror show
# snapmirror update -destination-path dstSVM:vol1

items.title: Certificates (common commands)
items.description: Certificate tooling varies by ONTAP version; use show commands to enumerate existing certs.
items.example: security certificate show

items.title: Audit and event basics
items.example: event log show -time >1h

categories.title: Monitoring, Logs, and Support
categories.description: Where to look when something breaks.

items.title: Event management system (EMS)
items.description: EMS is central for troubleshooting; filter by time, severity, message-name.
items.example: event log show -time >2h -severity ALERT,EMERGENCY

items.title: System performance quick checks
items.description: Use the performance subsystem for high-level checks; deeper analysis may require Active IQ/Harvest/Perfstat.
items.example: statistics show -object volume -instance -counter read_ops,write_ops,total_ops

items.title: AutoSupport
items.description: AutoSupport is used for support bundles and proactive health reporting.
items.example:
system node autosupport show
system node autosupport history show

categories.title: Automation: REST API, PowerShell, Ansible, Python
categories.description: Common patterns to automate ONTAP operations.

items.title: ONTAP REST API (curl patterns)
items.description: Use HTTPS and a least-privileged account. Endpoint paths depend on ONTAP version; query /api for discovery.
items.example:
curl -k -u user:pass https://cluster/api
curl -k -u user:pass 'https://cluster/api/storage/volumes?fields=name,svm,space'

items.title: PowerShell Toolkit (common)
items.description: Cmdlet names depend on toolkit version; connect then query common objects.
items.example:
Connect-NcController -Name cluster01 -Credential (Get-Credential)
Get-NcVserver
Get-NcVol

items.title: Ansible (collection hints)
items.description: NetApp provides Ansible collections for ONTAP; manage SVMs/volumes/LIFs declaratively.
items.example: ansible-galaxy collection install netapp.ontap

items.title: Python (netapp_ontap SDK)
items.description: Typical workflow: configure connection -> list/create resources (volumes, SVMs, LIFs).

rows: from netapp_ontap import HostConnection; HostConnection('cluster', username='u', password='p', verify=False).connect()
from netapp_ontap.resources import Volume; [v.name for v in Volume.get_collection()]

items.example: python3 -c "from netapp_ontap import HostConnection; from netapp_ontap.resources import Volume; HostConnection('cluster', username='u', password='p', verify=False).connect(); print([v.name for v in Volume.get_collection()])"

items.title: Provision NFS volume (typical flow)
items.description: High-level steps: SVM + LIF + volume + junction + export policy + client mount.

rows: vserver export-policy rule create -vserver <svm> -policyname <policy> -ruleindex 1 -protocol nfs3,nfs4 -clientmatch <cidr> -rorule sys -rwrule sys

items.example:
volume create -vserver svm1 -volume proj -aggregate aggr1 -size 200G
volume mount -vserver svm1 -volume proj -junction-path /data/proj
vserver export-policy create -vserver svm1 -policyname proj_pol
vserver export-policy rule create -vserver svm1 -policyname proj_pol -ruleindex 1 -protocol nfs3,nfs4 -clientmatch 10.0.0.0/24 -rorule sys -rwrule sys
volume modify -vserver svm1 -volume proj -policy proj_pol

items.title: Provision iSCSI LUN (typical flow)
items.description: High-level steps: data LIFs + iSCSI service + volume + LUN + igroup + map.
items.example:
vserver iscsi create -vserver svm1
volume create -vserver svm1 -volume vol_san -aggregate aggr1 -size 500G
lun create -vserver svm1 -path /vol/vol_san/lun01 -size 100G -ostype linux
igroup create -vserver svm1 -igroup ig01 -protocol iscsi -ostype linux -initiator iqn.1993-08.org.debian:01:aaaa
lun mapping create -vserver svm1 -path /vol/vol_san/lun01 -igroup ig01
